attributes.action: The Government to ensure EU funding is replaced on a like-for-like basis.
attributes.background:
A large number of projects across a wide field of endeavor, including such diverse things as scientific research and urban regeneration, are currently funded by the EU. As the UK disengages itself from the EU this funding will be withdrawn.
This could lead to many vital projects being abandoned.

attributes.action: Don't Hold a General Election on account of result of EU Referendum
attributes.background:
The UK has now entered a period of unparalleled uncertainty and this uncertainty is the biggest threat to continuing UK financial stability. 
Financial markets are already unsettled as it is, and a General Election would prolong the uncertainty and economic fallout of Brexit, at everyone's expense.
attributes.additional_details: Uncertainty over the outcome of the EU Referendum already had a significant impact on the UK economy prior to this vote, with foreign direct investment being put on hold as well as stock markets and sterling becoming increasingly volatile. Now a vote to leave has prolonged this period of uncertainty and is likely to have a significant short term economic impact. It is vital that a General Election is not called to ensure that the financial fallout of Brexit is not prolonged for UK households.

attributes.action: Make the government increase funds to support youth mental health.
attributes.background:
Due to national bed shortages in mental health units, many young people have been forced to move over 200 miles away from home, leaving loved ones behind.

0.6% of the NHS budget goes into helping young people with mental health, this is not enough.

attributes.action: Introduce a 3 strike policy before benefits can be sanctioned.
attributes.background: The use of automatic benefit sanctions is littered with examples of hardship incurred to those being sanctioned. There is no evidence that automatic benefit sanctions "help" people into work. It takes time to find a job, however anybody can have an emergency which causes them to miss an appointment.
attributes.additional_details:
http://tfne.ws/1him6Lp - "Half of all DWP sanctions wrongly imposed"
http://bit.ly/1Yex8Tr - "Warning vulnerable families are being pushed into poverty by wrongly imposed benefit sanctions"
http://bit.ly/1TYFXki - "A list of completely ridiculous benefit sanctions people have experienced"

attributes.action: Force childcare providers to cap escalating and over priced childcare costs
attributes.background: Since my son has been in private nursery, we have paid £14000. My son has been in nursery for 13 months! Over the course of two years, we would have paid £25000 which is enough for a deposit on a house. This is obscene and believe that childcare should be capped to no more than £45 per day.
attributes.additional_details: Not only do parents have to pay for bank holidays but also for family holidays making it near impossible to go on holiday for some families. Many parents earn nothing after paying childcare fees but yet we are urged to work. With some childcare providers charging in excess of £90 per day, how are we supposed to pay these costs?

attributes.action: Provide 'Be a Tree' training to children in schools.
attributes.background: I would like to see training provided to children in schools as to how to behave around dogs, in particular, the method of 'Be a Tree'.  The rationale behind this is in order to help prevent dog bites as a number of parents/adults are not aware of the behaviours that can lead to them.
attributes.additional_details: Dogs are stimulated by noise and movement. Unfortunately most children will be running around making a noise when they meet dogs. There are many kits already available, specifically aimed at teachers, such as http://www.clickertraining.com/node/3535 or http://www.be-a-tree.com/. It would be very easy for the Government to develop something similar for use in schools and is an easy way to educate everyone, as I'm sure children could be encouraged to impart what they have learned to their family.

attributes.action: Charge us more national insurance and properly fund the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is now running at a huge defecit. This can be easily solved. Charge us more national insurance - double it if you like. Use that money to properly/sustainably fund the NHS for a growing, ageing population. We'd much rather fund a public system for all than pay for private health insurance.

attributes.action: Compel Bookmakers to accept £100 wagers and ban closing accounts
attributes.background: Bookmakers are systematically closing accounts of any punter with even short term profits.this is totally contrary to them being licenced to accepting bets.A modest figure of £100 would hardly lay them open to nefarious acts but would equally give a fair deal.
attributes.additional_details: I am sure several thousands respondents will support this ,all with similar stories.

attributes.action: Stop allowing supermarkets to sell cheap alcohol.
attributes.background: The Pub Trade is dying, supermarkets are allowed to sell cheap alcohol which allows people to drink to excess and cause more stress on the NHS Police and other emergency services.  pubs are not allowed to do this by law.
attributes.additional_details:
All the major supermarkets are allowed to do the promotions i.e selling a litre of Vodka for aprox £15.
This stops people visiting bars and keeping them alive, pubs are being turned into shops and the community is losing out with having no where to go to celebrate birthdays etc.
We need to act now and save our pub's and clubs from disappearing .

attributes.action: Stop job discrimination against returning British Citizens
attributes.background: Government Departments have subcontracted recruitment companies (E.g. Capita) to manage the recruitment on their behalf. Some of these companies do not put forward candidates who have no been living in the UK for the past 3 - 5 years. This excludes British Citizens from working in the UK.

attributes.action: Make letting agents pay double the holding deposit for cancelling a tenancy.
attributes.background: Currently, letting agents require future tenants to immediately pay holding fees which is later offset against administration and referencing fees. However if letting agent chose to cancel the tenancy, they just return the holding fees and not any interest rate or penalties.
attributes.additional_details: If a letting agent cannot make the property available as per agreed tenancy start date And if the tenancy agreement was not signed by both parties until that time, then tenant has no rights and has to bear substantial consequential losses. If tenant decides to negotiate and threaten to take to property ombudsman (for breach of implied contract), the letting agent can cancel the offer for tenancy by returning just the initial monies with no interest rate and with no penalty.

attributes.action: Right to choose our own school holidays passed to parents
attributes.background: I would like to see the right to flexible school holidays passed to the parents and not just governed by local councils and schools. The old system is out of date and does not reflect modern living where both parents work.
attributes.additional_details: We as parents should have the choice to take our children out of school for the 20 days holiday that the government says we are entitled to as full time employees in this country. Schools should be open 50 weeks of the year with a only a week at Christmas and Easter as compulsory terms. All other holidays should be chosen by parents with a minimum of 4 weeks to be taken during the year but obviously not during exam times.

attributes.action: Replace extortionate fees (24%) charged to parents by CMS with standard fee.
attributes.background: Paying parent pays 20% - receiving parent pays 4% to CMS for setting up direct debit.  Fees are disproportionate to the effort required by CMS to effect payment.  Fees are significantly more than fees charged to make simple bank transfer or BACS payment, regardless of the amount involved.
attributes.additional_details: The 24% charge is a standard charge, whether payment is £1 or £1000.  This fee amounts to a lot for some paying parents and represents money that could be better spent on the children.  The CMS should at least explain the reasons for this extortionate fee level, and be transparent about what they actually do to deserve such a fee.  Monies already paid by parents should receive a refund along the lines of the PPI scandal.  (Will give CMS something to do!)

attributes.action: Companies to have Defibrillators
attributes.background:
Make it a mandatory requirement for businesses who employ over 50 persons either temporary or permanent to have a AED Automatic external defibrillator.
More than 100 Sudden Cardiac Arrests (SCA) take place in the UK each week with 95% of these being at a workplace.
attributes.additional_details: http://www.suddencardiacarrest.co.uk/

attributes.action: Make polygamy a specific criminal offence
attributes.background: Bigamy is a criminal offence in the UK and it therefor makes no sense for polygamy not to be a criminal offence.
attributes.additional_details: House of Commons Briefing Paper number 05051 dated 6th January 2016.

attributes.action: stop means testing carers allowance
attributes.background: us carers work hard to support our friends and family with dissabilities and yet we get money deducted from esa child tax working tax if we claim carers this is wrong.its a small price the goverment pay to us and then they take it back from other means,its wrong!!!

attributes.action: Restrict the maximum working hours of NHS staff to avoid mistakes being made.
attributes.background: This petition calls for the creation of legislation which limits the working hours of health care professionals who make decisions which affect patient safety, with the aim of preventing mistakes due to tiredness. It should be similar to GB and EU rules which restrict working hours for drivers.
attributes.additional_details:
Working long hours can lead to tiredness, which in turn can lead to dangerous mistakes being made. This is the reason for the existence of both GB domestic and EU legislation which restricts the number of hours drivers can work for in a week, how long they can drive for without a break and how long their breaks must be.

As NHS staff are often in situations at work where making a mistake can have extremely serious affects on patients health, a safe legal limit to working hours should apply.

attributes.action: Increase refuge spaces for male survivors of domestic violence
attributes.background: Currently there are only 11 government funded refuge places for male survivors of domestic violence yet 40% of domestic violence is against males

attributes.action: Make it so that gender segregation, within P.E at school, is no longer allowed.
attributes.background: School's have become accustomed to separating genders in P.E. This is understandable in contact sports, such as Rugby, but why should it be so in non-contact sports. Sign this petition so that gender segregation is a thing of the past!

attributes.action: Omit the requirement for a TV License in HM Forces Single Living Accommodation
attributes.background: At present all serving personnel in HM Forces Single Living Accommodation require a TV License. An exemption should be made for Forces personnel on HM establishments whom reside due to a duty move.
attributes.additional_details:
Many serving personnel temporarily reside at HM establishments throughout the week, thus require a TV License for two addresses. The one exemption to the rule is that a TV can be watched on a license for another address if the device is battery operated and not mains powered.  iaw http://www.tvlicensing.co.uk/check-if-you-need-one/for-your-home/armed-forces-personnel-aud7.
Serving personnel are requested to move frequently to temporary locations for training courses.

attributes.action: Equalise public spending per capita throughout the United Kingdom.
attributes.background: Scotland, Wales and Northern Ireland get higher payments per capita than England. This is unreasonable. All countries in the UK should receive the same amount per capita.
attributes.additional_details:
In 2014/15, public spending per capita in the UK as a whole was £8,913. In England, it was £8,638 (3% below the UK average). This compares with:
• Scotland: £10,374 (16% above the UK average – 20% higher than England)
• Wales: £9,904 (11% above the UK average – 14.7% higher than England)
• Northern Ireland £11,106 (25% above the UK average – 28.6% higher than England).
(Data source: House of Commons Briefing Paper Number 04300, 8 March 2015)

attributes.action: MP's and spouses/partners release tax returns from the date the are elected.
attributes.background: In the interests of complete transparency, the UK electorate need to know if elected officials and their spouses/partners have vested interests that help their decision making.
attributes.additional_details: From the date they are elected, all elected officials and their spouses/partners should be obligated to publish their tax returns.

attributes.action: Allow katy James to stay in the Uk with her husband and 2 year old daughter!
attributes.background:
Katy has been married to her husband Dominic for 9 years and they have a 2 year old daughter, Katy has been denied a visa because her husband doesn't "earn enough"

This is unfair and no parent should be seperated from their child

attributes.action: Force food companies to label ALL types of sugar on all packaging as SUGAR
attributes.background:
Regardless of how they sound, the following are all sugar:
Cane juice, Dehydrated cane juice, Cane juice solids, Cane juice crystals, Dextrin, Maltodextrin, Dextran, Barley malt, Beet sugar, Corn syrup, Carob syrup, Brown sugar, Date sugar, Malt syrup, Fruit juice, Fruit juice concentrate.
attributes.additional_details: One of the most common tricks is to distribute sugars among many ingredients so that sugars don‘t appear in the top three. For example, a manufacturer may use a combination of sucrose, high-fructose corn syrup, corn syrup solids, brown sugar, dextrose and other sugar ingredients to make sure none of them are present in large enough quantities to attain a top position on the ingredients list (remember, the ingredients are listed in order of their proportion in the food, common ingredients first !

attributes.action: DVLA need a telephone customer department that corrects the mistakes they  make
attributes.background:
DVLA fined us for their mistake with our DIrect Debit.
It has been shocking to find they have no telephone service for their mistakes to be sorted out.  Only telephone lines to pay the "fine" even when you don't owe them it. Very stressful time trying to sort it out.

attributes.action: all petitions with over 200000 signatures put to uk general election style vote
attributes.background:
petitions are often signed and not even discussed in parmlimant this gives the uk public a lack of confidence in the whole petition consept 
if every petition that reached 200000 signatures had to be voted on in an election style vote uk opinons would be voiced from the people for the people
attributes.additional_details:
this concept could be easily implimented by adding all succsesfull petitons to local and or general election questionares forms and voted on the same day reducing cost and increasing likelyhood to vote

the number 200000 is only a ballpar amount of votes if sucsesfull the amount of signature could be agreed upon for less or more but a garuntee of public intrest in the petiton idea would sertainly be sparked because the whole petition basis would have a more definative and resolved end result

attributes.action: Stop schools charging a fee to allow children to eat packed lunches.
attributes.background: Some state schools are charging parents up to £1.80 per child daily to eat a packed lunch on school premises. This is as much as the cost of a school meal.  Parents are paying twice to feed their children. The cost is disproportionate to the effort expended by the school to supervise lunchtimes.
attributes.additional_details:
This was uncovered by the teaching union NASUWT and reported in the press on 28th March 2016. 

http://www.telegraph.co.uk/education/educationnews/12206157/State-schools-charge-parents-to-let-children-eat-their-own-packed-lunches.html

attributes.action: Make dog ownership require certified training and registered accountability.
attributes.background: Dogs are potentially dangerous animals whose behaviour should be governed appropriately. Handler training equips owners with skills and techniques needed to ensure safe standards of behaviour. Recognised registration of ownership of an animal would give traceable and enforceable accountability.

attributes.action: Introduce other religious leaders into the house of lords to make it democratic
attributes.background: The only religious leaders in the House of Lords are bishops and arch bishops but as Britain is now a multi faith country other religious leaders from Muslim, Hindu and Sikh (etc) faiths should be entered to the house in order to offer greater representation and democracy and scrutiny in Britain.

attributes.action: Scrap the plan to bring in a tax on sugary drinks
attributes.background: The tax on sugary drinks announced by the Chancellor in the budget on 16/03/16 impinges on the rights of people to choose what they would like to consume and how to raise their children. This is an illiberal policy showcasing the worst excesses of big government intrusion into people's lives.
attributes.additional_details: Childhood obesity is a multi-faceted problem, caused by poor diet, a lack of exercise and a societal acceptance of weight gain. A tax on sugary drinks is unlikely to make any kind of impact on this problem, and is simply a headline grabbing measure. These taxes have been shown to be largely ineffective in the countries where they have been implemented, achieving only price rises in products that hit the poorest hardest.

attributes.action: Make bullying in schools a criminal offence and prosecute teachers who ignore it
attributes.background: My children and other friends children have been subject to bullying. We are also dismayed and frustrated at the lack of action by schools on the issue of bullying and their wish to brush it all under the carpet whilst bullies seem to be able to carry on making other people's lives a misery.
attributes.additional_details:
My son was bullied and his friend assaulted by an older pupil who threw stones at them badly injuring my son's friend. The police were involved as this was considered common assault. The school took no action against the pupil as they said this was a police matter and was contrary to their won policies.
My daughter is now being bullied, I have reported this to the school but have little faith anything will be done.

attributes.action: Vaccinate all children against the ACWY strain of meningitis
attributes.background: My son contracted the Men W strain of meningococcal septacimia at age 20 months in April 2015, he was extremely poorly and got turned away from 3 health professionals as having a virus until I went by my cut instinct and took him to the children's hospital. He had no rash and we almost lost him.
attributes.additional_details:
Cases of meningitis and septicaemia due to Men W have been increasing in England, from 22 cases in 2009 to 117 in 2014. The increase seems to be speeding up in 2015, caused by an aggressive strain of the bug. But it's fatal in about 1 in 10 cases and can lead to long-term health problems.
Men W infections are particularly severe and usually need to be treated in intensive care. They have a higher death rate than the more common Men C and Men B strains.

attributes.action: Cap Benefits for a maximum of 3 kids starting from the day of implementation.
attributes.background: Lets deter people from having kids for benefit reasons. By capping benefits at three kids we can reduce the benefit bill, stop people from taking advantage of the system.

attributes.action: Refer Amazon to the competition authorities.
attributes.background: In The Telegraph interview Rohan Silva, a former adviser to David Cameron and George Osborne, said the lack of competition in the book market is “really horrifying”, allowing Amazon to dominate.I’m absolutely aghast about what the government and competition authorities have allowed Amazon to do.
attributes.additional_details:
What the Society of Authors and their memebers think of Amazon can be found here: http://www.societyofauthors.org/what-do-we-think-amazon

The background to this petition can be found at this link: http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/shopping-and-consumer-news/12167545/Government-must-help-end-heartbreaking-Amazon-dominance-former-Number-10-adviser-says.html?WT.mc_id=e_DM89475&WT.tsrc=email&etype=Edi_Pol_New_EU&utm_source=email&utm_medium=Edi_Pol_New_EU_2016_02_22&utm_campaign=DM89475

attributes.action: Facilitate 100% mortgages for those renting privately.
attributes.background: There is gap in the 'help to buy' scheme that doesn't facilitate those people who are stuck in the private rental market.  People that regularly evidence the ability to make mortgage payment, but do not have the ability to put away enough savings to reach a 5-10% deposit.
attributes.additional_details: There is a next generation issue, of those people that have young families but are now stuck in the rental market.  Quite often the rental costs are higher than what a mortgage would cost, but due to the often higher rental changes to facilitate a family home these people can not accrue enough savings quickly enough to purchase a property.

attributes.action: Start a public consultation and debate about the future funding of the NHS
attributes.background: The NHS is in financial crisis. I believe it is now time for the electorate to be consulted for their views on how this might be resolved for the future, as successive governments appear to be struggling to find a solution.

attributes.action: Make it illegal to ban packed lunches in schools and nurseries
attributes.background: Schools and nurseries in the UK have started to BAN packed lunches, some reasons for this include: Healthy eating and allergies. As parents, it should be a constitutional right to feed our own children.
attributes.additional_details:
I completely agree there should be a CLEAR packed lunch policy containing details of banned foods but to ban them all together is wrong. 

http://www.barnsleychronicle.com/article/parents-take-action-after-schools-packed-lunch-ban

http://www.spiked-online.com/newsite/article/banning-packed-lunches-a-slap-in-the-face-for-parents/15389#.V8CBAPkrKM8

attributes.action: Stop the airstrikes/bombings in Syria
attributes.background: British parliament to re-vote on military action in Syria, in light of the civilian casualities this has caused. British govt to put pressure on the Syrian govt and the coalition forces to ground their airforces & stop bombarding civilian areas, schools & hospitals through indiscriminate strikes.
attributes.additional_details:
The UK has been the second largest contributor to the air campaign in Iraq. In November 2015 the government suggested that the UK had carried out 8% of coalition air strikes in Iraq. 

On 7 July 2016 the MOD confirmed that the UK had conducted more than 2,800 missions, including 915 airstrikes against ISIS targets in both Iraq and more recently Syria (865 and 50 strikes respectively). It went on to state that “the RAF has not operated at this sustained operational tempo in a single theatre of conflict for a quarter of a century”.

The Government has consistently maintained that no civilian casualties in Iraq or Syria, to date, have resulted from UK air strikes. This is no longer accurate and thus the policy on offensive action needs to be revisited.

attributes.action: Ensure that every train has a guard.
attributes.background: It should be a condition of offering a franchise to a Train Operating Company that every train has a guard. This improves safety and service and is reassuring for the travelling public, especially the elderly, disabled, and passengers with young children.

attributes.action: Agree never to sell or give our NHS details to anyone outside the NHS.
attributes.background: Apparently this proposal is back again. There is a proposal to sell all our details to the private sector. This was defeated once and needs to be defeated again. Let's get it debated in Parliament.

attributes.action: Force advertisers to label manipulated images and provide link to original media
attributes.background: Our children and young adults are surrounded by media portraying unnatural and mostly unattainable body images. In many cases that media has been considerably digitally manipulated (eg, airbrushing) and I propose legislation for such images to include a link to the original unenhanced image.
attributes.additional_details: Many studies and reports show the negative effect on our younger generation of being constantly subjected to images of such extreme and artificial body images. By forcing the producers of such media to include a link to the original image (by way of, say, a reference number or QR code or similar) the media would be more transparent to such harmful image manipulation.

attributes.action: To Criminalize Ticket buying bots from buying up tickets for events
attributes.background: Ticket Buying bots should be criminalized and the practice made illegal. botnets are programmes which are used to target ticketing agents. They buy tickets at high speed and stop fans from being able to buy tickets at face value the tickets are then resold on other sites at greater value
attributes.additional_details:
For Example Harry potter tickets £15 pounds per part on the official website 
Stubhub ticket web site anything from £150 - £1750

attributes.action: Have a minimum age of 12 years old before having a body piercing.
attributes.background: Babies and toddlers often have their ears pierced because their parents think it will look nice. It causes the child pain and puts them at risk of infection. It should be left to the individual as to whether they wish to have holes made through their own skin when they are old enough to understand.

attributes.action: Conduct a 2nd, more complex, EU membership referendum with multiple answers.
attributes.background: The first EU membership referendum had polarised wording and lacked options which truly reflected the range of sentiment toward the EU found across the UK. To empower the people, a more complex range of possible outcomes should be provided which serves both the voter and the EU/next generation.
attributes.additional_details: 1st EU referendum.

attributes.action: Benefit sanctions must be stopped without exception.
attributes.background: Benefit sanctions are being handed out unlawfully.

attributes.action: Stop Housing Associations charging more than social rent on their properties.
attributes.background: My 20 years old has a 1 bedroom Circle 33 Housing Association property and her rent in £189.00 per week.  Another Circle property 2 minutes away is £129.00 p/w. She is under so much stress and anxiety worrying about getting work and paying her rent and not ending up homeless.
attributes.additional_details: She will have to claim a portion of Housing Benefit as she will not be in a position to pay it all herself.  Surely if the rent was lowered there would be smaller claims for Housing Benefit, possibly no claims at all in some circumstances being made. Surely it is common sense to reduce the rent to reduce the amount of Housing Benefit claims being made.  There is nothing included the £189.00 rent, e.g. water rates or care taking facilities.

attributes.action: Have a new runway at both Gatwick and Heathrow
attributes.background: If this Government decides on one or other it won't be long before we'll have the whole debate again. Having spare capacity at both airports will be an operational relief and set us up for the next decades.

attributes.action: All public transport buses to have seat belts.
attributes.background: I have seen many videos on social media of buses in road accidents. Passengers fly out of their seats. Young children fly out of their seats. I for one will not be taking my child on a bus until they have seat belts fitted. A bus is no different to a car. In fact it's probably worse.

attributes.action: Relax the rules on appearance to allow service personnel to blend in more.
attributes.background: After recent attempted kidnapping of a serviceman I think it's time that the rules governing appearance and grooming should be permanently relaxed to allow serviceman appear to be a member of public.

attributes.action: Incentivise businesses to increase the number of Standing Desks for employees
attributes.background: Employees spend 40+ hours a week at their desks, the lack of movement is a key problem in the obesity pandemic. Introducing standing desks DRAMATICALLY reduces this and the chances of type II diabetes. Getting businesses to bring in standing desks will help make Britain healthier. We need guidelines
attributes.additional_details:
Some of the benefits of standing desks have been ratified by research conducted in the States and in Britain. According to the researchers 'Sitting is the new smoking'. 

Below are some articles which list the benefits:

http://www.smithsonianmag.com/science-nature/five-health-benefits-standing-desks-180950259/?no-ist
https://authoritynutrition.com/7-benefits-of-a-standing-desk
